4. If your gas pedal is stuck, you should:
column4: hook your shoe under the pedal and see if you can free it. If not, shift into neutral and use the brake to slow your vehicle and get off the road.
column6: ease your foot off the gas pedal and brake gently.
column8: turn off the ignition if your vehicle has power steering.

column2: 5. Service signs are ____ with ____ letters and symbols.
6. The sign in the picture:
column4: shows the highest speed drivers can travel at the exit of the intersection.
column6: indicates the minimum ramp speed at the highway exit point.
column8: is used to advise motorists of the appropriate ramp speed at the highway exit point.

column2: 7. This sign tells drivers that:
column6: left and right turns are not allowed.

column2: 8. To make a proper right turn:
column4: swing to the left before turning right.
column6: slow down and get into the lane nearest the centerline.
column8: give the proper signal and get into the lane nearest the right curb.

column2: 9. What do warning signs mean?
column4: Drivers are approaching a location where there is a special rule.

column2: 10. What does this road sign indicate?
column4: Motor vehicles entering an exclusive right-turn lane must weave across bicycle traffic in bicycle lanes.
column6: Vehicles turning left must yield to bikes entering a right turn lane.
column8: Drivers have the right of way over bikes turning left.

column2: 11. When a ‘Road Closed’ sign is displayed, drivers must:
column4: look for a detour or another route.
column6: come to a complete stop and wait for the lights to turn green.

15. The side mirror(s) should be set so when you lean left/right you:
column4: can see half of your vehicle.
column6: can barely see the side of your vehicle.

column2: 16. When parking uphill on a road with a curb, turn the front wheels:
17. When changing lanes, drivers should never:
column6: glance over their shoulder to check for blind spots.
column8: check to see if other drivers are moving into the same lane.

column2: 18. What does this sign indicate?
column4: Winding road ahead. Drive with caution.
column6: Drivers will soon be on a roadway with two-way traffic.
column8: The highway ahead is divided into two one-way roadways.

column2: 19. Motorcycles:
column4: must share a traffic lane with another vehicle.
column6: are entitled to use a complete traffic lane.
column8: are easier to see than cars.

column2: 20. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column6: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column8: stay focused on the center line on the road.

column2: 21. If you meet a stopped school bus with the lights flashing and the signal arm extended, you should:
column6: proceed at 15 MPH or less, if no children are present.
column8: watch for children and proceed at normal speed.

column2: 22. If an intersection has crosswalk lines but no STOP line, where must you stop for a red light?
23. When parking on a public road, drivers should:
column4: always park on the left side of the roadway.
column6: move as far away from traffic as possible.

column2: 24. If your car goes into water, you should:
column4: wait for water to rush in and let it out in small breaths through your nose.
column8: remove yourself before it starts to sink.
